meanings.definition: A person who sells or trades in fruit.
meanings.sent1: The fruiters at the market always have the freshest fruits.
meanings.sent2: The fruiters set up their stalls early in the morning to sell their produce.
meanings.sent3: The fruiters had a competition to see who could juggle the most apples without dropping any.
meanings.sent4: She was a true fruiter, always knowing the best fruits to pick for each season.
meanings.sent5: The fruiters' colorful displays attracted many customers to their stand.

meanings.definition: A ship or vessel used for transporting fruit.
meanings.sent1: The fruiter sailed across the ocean carrying crates of oranges.
meanings.sent2: The crew loaded the fruiter with bananas bound for distant lands.
meanings.sent3: The fruiter had a special room to keep the fruit safe from rough seas.
meanings.sent4: The fruiter glided through the water like a giant floating fruit basket.
meanings.sent5: The fruiter's cargo of pineapples filled the air with a sweet aroma.

meanings.definition: To engage in the business of selling or trading fruit.
meanings.sent1: They decided to fruiter in the local market to earn some extra money.
meanings.sent2: During the summer, many farmers fruiter to make a living.
meanings.sent3: He tried to fruiter in exotic fruits, but the customers preferred the classics.
meanings.sent4: She would fruiter at the street corner, offering the ripest peaches.
meanings.sent5: Fruit vendors fruiter enthusiastically to attract more customers to their stands.
